statements.statement: 1. In a course like this, I prefer review material that really challenges me so I can learn new things that may be asked on the board exam.
2. If I study in appropriate ways, then I will be able to learn enough to pass boards.
3. When I take an exam like the ones in this course, I think about how poorly I am doing compared with other students.
4. I'm certain I can master the review material presented in this course.
5. Getting a good grade on the mock board is the most satisfying thing for me right now.
6. When I take exams such as these in this course, I think about items on other parts of the exam I am struggling to answer.
7. It is my own fault if I don't learn the important material required for boards.
8. It is important for me to learn the material reviewed in this course.
9. The most important thing is passing the board exam really well.
10. I'm confident I can understand the basic concepts taught in this board prep course.
11. If I can, I want to get better grades on the mock board exam than other students in the class.
12. When I take exams that emulate the board exam, I think of the consequences of failing.
13. I prefer course material that will arouse my curiosity, even if it is difficult to learn.
14. I am very interested in the content area of this course.
15. If I try hard enough, then I will understand all the material required for boards.
16. I have an uneasy, upset feeling when I take an exam that relates to the board exam.
17. The most satisfying thing for me is trying to understand the content as thoroughly as possible.
18. Understanding the subject matter reviewed in this course is very important to me.
19. I feel my heart beating fast when I take an exam.
20. I want to do well in this course because it is important to show my ability to my family, friends, or others.
21. I believe I will receive an excellent grade on the mock board exam.
22. I'm certain I can understand the most difficult concepts reviewed in this course.
23. When studying for boards, I often try to explain the material to a classmate or a friend.
24. I often feel so lazy or bored when I study that I quit before I finish what I planned to do.
25. Even if I have trouble learning the material for boards, I try to do the work on my own, without help from anyone.
26. I try to work with other students to study for the board exam.
27. I am working hard to do well even if I don't like what I am studying.
28. When studying, I often set aside time to discuss the course material with a group of students from the class.
29. When I can't understand the material, I am supposed to be studying, I ask another student in this class for help
30. I ask the instructor to clarify concepts I don't understand well.
31. When course work is difficult, I give up or only study the easy parts.
32. When I study concepts for the board exam, I outline the material to help me organize my thoughts.
33. During class time I often miss important points because Iâ€™m thinking of other things
34. Even when materials I'm studying are dull and uninteresting, I manage to keep working until I finish the section.
35. When working through material, I make up questions to help focus my thoughts.
36. When I become confused about something I'm studying, I go back and try to figure it out.
37. When I study, I go through my class notes and try to find the most important ideas.
38. I make good use of my study time.
39. If course materials are difficult to understand, I change the way I approach the material.
40. When studying for boards, I read my class handouts over and over.
41. When a theory, interpretation, or conclusion is presented in class or in the readings, I try to decide if there is good supporting evidence.
42. I make simple charts, diagrams, concept maps or tables to help me organize the material.
43. When I study for a class, I pull together information from different sources, such as lectures, readings, and external sources.
44. I often find that I have been reading but don't have a clue as to what it was all about
45. I memorize key words to remind me of important concepts when I study.
46. When learning new material, I try to relate the material to what I already know.
47. I usually study for boards in a regular place where I can concentrate on my course work.
48. When I study, I write brief summaries of the main ideas and concepts from the lectures.
49. I try to understand the material presented in classes by making connections between the lectures.
50. I make sure I keep up my weekly board prep schedule.
51. Whenever I read or hear an assertion or conclusion in this review course, I think about possible alternatives.
52. When I study, I make lists of important terms and memorize the list.
53. I often find that I don't spend much time on board prep because of other activities.
54. I try to apply ideas from readings in one course to understand topics in another course that need to be studied for the mock board.
